name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Sheffield Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 2 day Chatsworth Break at the Sheffield Park Hotel. Our room 305 faced the main road but when we closed the double glazed window it was exceptionally quiet even with cars and lorries continually travelling up and down. The room was very comfortable & clean. My only complaint would be the depressing of the toilet flush in the bathroom. With my arthritic fingers it was not easy. The food in the restaurant was of a very good standard although, surprisingly, I ordered the same starter and main course from the A-La-Carte menu on both evenings. That was because I had enjoyed it so much the first night, and yet both courses were slightly different on the second night and not quite as good. The staff were very friendly, courteous and polite. The main question would be would I return - yes if I needed to visit Sheffield again.
reviews.title: Very Quiet - Even facing main road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Kept awake till 1 a.m. by noise from doors shutting along the corridor. Then woken at 6 a.m. by next door's mobile phone. Internal soundproofing not good. The room itself was nice. Staff friendly, helpful but there was great confusion at check-in (caused partly by another reservation with the same surname as me - surely not that unusual?). Was nearly charged double for the very mediocre breakfast. Would not recommend this hotel for light sleepers.
reviews.title: Noisy - not for light sleepers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time here. The hotel is well placed for visits to the Peak District, easy to get in and out of the area. Our room was clean and had plenty of room. A nice view looking over a small garden, very quite. The reception staff we very helpful as were the dining room staff. All young and very keen to help. The food was well prepared, cooked and presented, great value and good choice. The pool and other facilities are well used and at the end of a long day walking very welcome. If we are ever in the area again I would love to come back.
reviews.title: Would love to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here with my mother for two nights as a Mothers Day present for her. The reception staff were very friendly and although we were early, they checked with housekeeping to get us a room straight away. The room was fine with everything we needed, although the fridge wasn't working. I reported it to reception who promised to have it looked at the following day and sent up an ice bucket immediately. They did as promised and found that it needed a part to repair it. We were offered a different room or to have an ice bucket again. It didn't seem worth moving for one more night so we chose the latter which again was brought to us immediately.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The pool was lovely and warm and the changing rooms were very clean with plenty of lockers. We hadn't taken any money to the pool area with us so the nice guy on reception lent us £1 for the lockers rather than sending us back to our room to get money. We'd booked a spa treatment each and although the spa area wasn't very big, the therapist was very friendly and the massage was fab.
reviews.title: Worth revisiting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite not enjoying my stay for reasons you'll read in this review, the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The duty manager did everything she could to make things better.
reviews.title: Staff - helpful and accomodating, sleep quality poor - do not stay at front of hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our stay was for a romantic weekend break as it was my birthday over the weekend, and our last trip as a couple alone for a while, as we're expecting our first baby in July. We booked the Chatsworth weekend break, with upgraded Executive double bedroom, cookies and dressing gowns etc. This is an extremely good value deal including a dinner to the value of £22 each on the first night, bottle of wine, bed and breakfast accommodation and 2 tickets to Chatsworth house and gardens.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel - wish we could have stayed a bit longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Upon arrival, our credit card was swiped for the usual reasons, I thought to cover the cost of our stay should we disappear without paying. We settled into our room which was comfortable and roomy, with flat screen tv. We noticed it was quite dusty on the surfaces, and the ceiling looked like it could do with a re-paint, but generally the room was in good condition.
reviews.title: NICE HOTEL, SERVICE COULD BE BETTER, BUT WOULD RECOMMEND

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking at the pool, it was very busy and would not have been relaxing as it was too small for the amount of people wishing to use it.
reviews.title: Cost cutting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our dinner was reasonably tasty and service from staff pleasant, even if they did forget us a little towards the end! When settling the dinner invoice, it turned out that the £1.80 we'd overspent on the dinner inclusive option could not be charged to our room, as we'd not opted for that upon check in, despite having our card swiped! So we had to return to our room to get the cash and pay at the restaurant - most peculiar!
reviews.title: well thought-out comfortable accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was well placed for our visit to the Peak District and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed two nights and had dinner at the hotel on both nights and the food was excellent. Beds very comfortable and the standard of cleanliness was good. Quiet despite facing the A61 a double highway, but far away enough not to create a problem. Altogether a very pleasant say. Thanks to staff.
reviews.title: Far exceeded my expectaions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Sheffield Park Hotel on the 4th June as a stopover on our way to Manchester for the Take That tour. We were just looking for a comfortable hotel to lay our heads and i chose this one as the price was good (£75 including breakfast) and the reviews on here.
reviews.title: Superb facilities and attentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival there was no queue at all and we were checked in quickly. Our room was very spacious and spotlessly clean. We had a large 37 inch LCD television, mini fridge, safe, seating area, desk with Nicky Clarke hairdryer etc everything you need.
reviews.title: excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We immediately went to test the leisure facilities as we wanted to make the most of our time here. The pool area wasn't too busy, we used the spa bath, sauna and steam room too. The changing rooms are well equipped and everywhere clean and well maintained, towels are also provided.
reviews.title: As good as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had dinner in the restaurant also, the a la carte menu has plenty of choice and all looked great. We opted for the table d'hote menu where 2 courses were £15.50 and 3 for £18.95. The food was delicious, and the staff were smiling and friendly. When i needed to check the ingredients in a dish due to an allergy the waiter checked immediately and even came back a little later to make sure what i was getting wouldnt cause any problems.
reviews.title: Could have been fantastic...what a shame we were let down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights on the Chatsworth package. The Executive room was fine. Well equipped, nicely decorated, comfortable bed and everything worked well.
reviews.title: Essentially a conference hotel but very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Dinner in the restaurant was reasonable without being very exciting; it wasn't possible to have three courses from the a la carte menu within the evening allowance and the fixed price menu wasn't attractive. Breakfast on the first morning was fine bar the toast which was soggy on both mornings. On the second morning the servery hadn't been topped up and there were no eggs (fried or scrambled), no bacon and no sign of any of the crew going for replacements. Throughout our stay the staff were very friendly but on several counts the breakfast crew were not very alert. The Reception and Housekeeping staff were very good. On the second night we ate out (at the Plough at Hathersage. A little pricey but very good food and excellent service).
reviews.title: very friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Had a lovely stay. great value for money. Breakfast very good, great choice of hot and cold food.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Did not try room service, but did get some hot drinks from the bar and the staff were really frieldly nothing too much travel.
reviews.title: A good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a hen weekend in May. Check-in was very good and went smoothly, very helpful Receptionists. All rooms were available at the allocated time which was good.
reviews.title: not really a four star

description: The DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Sheffield Park is a contemporary hotel with top-quality 4-star facilities. Situated on the outskirts of Sheffield, yet with superb travel links, this DoubleTree by Hilton hotel is the perfect base for South Yorkshire, The Peak District and North Derbyshire. This is one of the few hotels in Sheffield able to offer complimentary car parking, fully air-conditioned bedrooms, 11 meeting rooms, an award-winning restaurant and revive Health Club making it the best place for your next stay in Sheffield. The Hotel holds a Four Star AA rating and an AA Rosette.
